description: When classes share responsibilities and collaborators, lift them into a base class. Use ': BaseClass' notation for inheritance. Reference base type in relationships instead of enumerating subtypes. Example: Scanner base with Scans/Reports; ImportPlacementScanner : Scanner adds Validates import ordering.

do.description: Abstract shared responsibilities into base class, subclasses add specific ones. Example: Scanner base with Scans/Reports; ImportPlacementScanner : Scanner adds specific validation

guidance.description: Move repeated responsibilities and collaborators to base class
example: Scans scope for violations: Violation, Scope, Rule
Validates import ordering: Boolean, Block, ImportRules
Validates identifier names: Boolean, Block, NamingRules
(Shared scan/report in base; specific validation in subclasses)

guidance.description: Reference base type in parent relationships
example: Coordinates scan: Scan, Scanner, Scope (uses base Scanner type)
Executes with scanner: Violation, Scanner, Rule (uses base Scanner type)
(Parent objects reference Scanner, not ImportPlacementScanner, NamingScanner, etc.)

guidance.description: Show inheritance clearly with ': BaseClass' notation

dont.description: Don't duplicate responsibilities or enumerate all subtypes. Example: Each scanner duplicating Scans/Reports (wrong) vs inheriting from Scanner base (right)

guidance.description: Don't repeat same responsibilities in every subclass
example: Scans scope for violations: Violation, Scope, Rule
Scans scope for violations: Violation, Scope, Rule
(Scan/report duplicated - should be in base Scanner)

guidance.description: Don't list every concrete subtype when base type exists
example: Coordinates scan: Scan, ImportPlacementScanner, NamingScanner, CommentScanner, ...
(Should use base Scanner type, not enumerate all scanners)
